com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.achievemen: Do 3,000 damage to opposing Pokémon with your {P} Pokémon.
Do 3,000 damage to opposing Pokémon with your {W} Pokémon.
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.archetypes: This card can only be attached to {W} Pokémon. This card provides {W} Energy only while this card is attached to a {W} Pokémon.If the {W} Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, put that Pokémon into your hand. (Discard all cards attached to it.)(If this card is attached to anything other than a {W} Pokémon, discard this card.)
Once during each player's turn, if that player's Active Pokémon is Asleep, he or she may remove that Special Condition and heal 30 damage from that Pokémon.

If this card is attached to 1 of your Pokémon, discard it at the end of your opponent's turn.If the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 6 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
Discard any Stadium card in play. If you do, your opponent discards 3 cards from his or her hand.
The Basic Pokémon this card is attached to gets +40 HP and its attacks do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Gyarados-EX.
Look at the top 6 cards of your deck and attach a basic Energy card you find there to a Basic Pokémon on your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Heal all damage from 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, discard all Energy attached to that Pokémon.
Discard a card from your hand. If you do, look at the top 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.
Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
Your opponent reveals his or her hand.Discard as many cards as you like from your hand. Then, draw that many cards.

You may play 2 Puzzle of Time cards at once.• If you played 1 card, look at the top 3 cards of your deck and put them back in any order.• If you played 2 cards, put 2 cards from your discard pile into your hand.

Choose which way this card faces before you play it. The attacks of this ↓ player's {D} Pokémon do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).\n\nAny damage done to this ↓ player's {M} Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Scizor-EX.
Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.decks.pcds: Eyes on the Prize!\nCommand the gleaming eyes of Luxray and strike fast with the crackling fists of Electivire! Stare down your opponent with the hypnotic mastery and total focus of the Electric Eye theme deck!
Call the Ocean's Fury!\nCut through waves and slash foes in the battle arena—flow like water and bend like grass! Greninja and Slowking come to your call in the Wave Slasher theme deck!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.products.b: Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Florges promo card and an XY—BREAKthrough themed deck box for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Flabébé promo card and a set of XY—BREAKthrough themed card sleeves for you to enjoy or trade!
Thank you for attending your local Pokémon League! This code will unlock a foil Floette promo card and an XY—BREAKthrough themed coin for you to enjoy or trade!

Eyes on the Prize!\nCommand the gleaming eyes of Luxray and strike fast with the crackling fists of Electivire! Stare down your opponent with the hypnotic mastery and total focus of the Electric Eye theme deck!
Call the Ocean's Fury!\nCut through waves and slash foes in the battle arena—flow like water and bend like grass! Greninja and Slowking come to your call in the Wave Slasher theme deck!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.rules.abilities: Heal 30 damage from both Active Pokémon.
Turn 1 of your face-down Prize cards face up. If that Prize card is a Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage. (That Prize card remains face up for the rest of the game.)
This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Your opponent puts a card from his or her hand on the bottom of his or her deck.
Search your deck for 2 {W} Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.
Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.
If you have any Mega Evolution Pokémon on your Bench, this attack does 50 more damage.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 80 more damage.
You may do 20 more damage for each {W} Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, discard the top 2 cards of your deck.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
If your opponent attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn, that Pokémon will be Asleep.
This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Search your deck for up to 3 {G} Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon has {F} Resistance, this attack does 60 more damage.
Draw a card. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 80 more damage.
This attack does 20 more damage for each {D} Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.
Discard a Special Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Discard all Pokémon Tool cards attached to that Pokémon.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 40 more damage.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Discard the top card of your deck.
This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attach up to 2 Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
This attack does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy card discarded in this way.
Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.
If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 60 more damage.
Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, prevent that attack's damage done to this Pokémon if that damage is 60 or less.
Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.
You may discard a Special Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon or a Stadium card in play.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
This attack does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
You may attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.
Devolve each of your opponent's evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.
During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by {N} Pokémon.
You may return a {W} Energy from this Pokémon to your hand. If you do, this attack does 20 more damage.
Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.
Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.
Double the number of damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon.
Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 60 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Flip 4 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
During your next turn, this Pokémon's Psych Up attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Your opponent reveals his or her hand.
This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.
During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 5 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 20 more damage.
Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
Flip 3 coins. If any of them are heads, your opponent reveals his or her hand. Then, for each heads, discard a card from your opponent's hand.
This attack does 10 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.
The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, discard the top 4 cards of your opponent's deck.
During your next turn, any damage done to the Defending Pokémon by attacks is increased by 60 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 4 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

Until the end of your opponent's next turn, each Pokémon your opponent has in play, in his or her hand, and in his or her discard pile has no Abilities. (This includes cards that come into play on that turn.)
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. That Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Put 3 damage counters on each of your opponent's Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attach 3 Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.
During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon for each {C} in that Pokémon's Retreat Cost. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.
This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your deck for a {W} Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.
If this Pokémon evolved from Shellder during this turn, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.
Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.
Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.
If you use this attack when you have only 1 Prize card left, you win this game.
If your opponent's Pokémon used an attack during his or her last turn, use it as this attack.
Search your deck for up to 3 Frogadier and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.
Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 more damage for each heads.
This Pokémon can't be affected by any Special Conditions. (Remove any Special Conditions affecting this Pokémon.)
Each of your Pokémon that has any {W} Energy attached to it has no Retreat Cost.
If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities (except for Garbotoxin).
Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may discard a {W} Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 6 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may leave both Active Pokémon Asleep.
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Basic Pokémon's attacks cost {C} more.
If this Pokémon's remaining HP is 50 or less, its attacks do 70 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon has any basic {R} Energy attached to it, you may heal 50 damage from it.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, move an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon to 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to each of your Pokémon. (Existing effects are not removed.)
Damage from the attacks of your {L} Pokémon isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Raticate BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.
com.tpci.cake.data.decks.pcds.2016auroru: Aurorus-EX arrives in a chilly blast of pure Pokémon power! The Pokémon TCG: Aurorus-EX Box brings you this ancient Tundra Pokémon as a full-power Pokémon-EX. Its colorful sail and frozen charm are sure to delight!
com.tpci.cake.data.decks.pcds.2016breake: BREAK Evolution is the newest way to power up your Pokémon—and this box contains not 1 but 3 new Pokémon BREAK! Make a break for victory with the Pokémon TCG: BREAK Evolution Box today!
com.tpci.cake.data.decks.pcds.2016megaae: A flying Fossil Pokémon that packs a furious punch—Mega Aerodactyl-EX is here! Get the Mega Aerodactyl-EX Premium Collection, and add this power Pokémon to your next game!
Pokémon TCG: Mega Aerodactyl-EX Premium Collection

Elite Trainer Mega Gyarados Card Sleeves
product.xy9.booster.description: The hour grows desperate, and two worlds stand at the brink! The Pokémon TCG: XY—BREAKpoint expansion reveals the growing rift between the twin worlds, first discovered by Shiny Mega Gyarados-EX. As the rift tears through the skies, more Pokémon are drawn into the struggle, including Greninja BREAK, Luxray BREAK, and Mega Scizor-EX! Can they mend the rift and save both worlds from collision chaos?

product.xy9.pcd.waveslasher.name: Wave Slasher
